intro: Valeriana phaseoli, commonly known as climbing valerian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Its roots contain volatile oils and alkaloids, which contribute to its use in traditional medicine. Valeriana phaseoli is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
